item.title: The Idola Tribus of AI: Large Language Models tend to perceive order where none exists
item.description: arXiv:2510.09709v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a tendency of large language models (LLMs) to generate absurd patterns despite their clear inappropriateness in a simple task of identifying regularities in number series. Several approaches have been proposed to apply LLMs to complex real-...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> experiment, retrieval, arxiv, framework, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: All Code, No Thought: Current Language Models Struggle to Reason in Ciphered Language
item.description: arXiv:2510.09714v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Detecting harmful AI actions is important as AI agents gain adoption. Chain-of-thought (CoT) monitoring is one method widely used to detect adversarial attacks and AI misalignment. However, attackers and misaligned models might evade CoT monitoring th...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, CoT, alignment, chain-of-thought, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: The Personalization Trap: How User Memory Alters Emotional Reasoning in LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2510.09905v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: When an AI assistant remembers that Sarah is a single mother working two jobs, does it interpret her stress differently than if she were a wealthy executive? As personalized AI systems increasingly incorporate long-term user memory, understanding how ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> memory, arxiv, large language model, LLM, reasoning | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: DPCformer: An Interpretable Deep Learning Model for Genomic Prediction in Crops

Traditional GS methods, however, struggle with prediction accuracy for complex traits and large datasets.
